attributes.action: current circumstances hasn’t this made you realise we need our local farmers
attributes.additional_details: Support our products let them be know for how amazing they are we use our farmers Service everyday 3 times a day if not more.asda and Sainsbury’s buy imports from Poland all the transport is bad if we supported Britain their would be this travelling and we would know that our animal that we are eating is good quality and has been treated well and hasn’t been injected with chemicals support Britain today and get trustworthy meat.
attributes.background: I think as a nation we need to support British farmers more on a whole and make all / most meats in our uk stores our nation own.we as British farmers have high animal wealth fare standards and a lot of countries want our standards.why don’t we support them? Before it’s to late support British

rejection.details:
We understand that you want the Government to support British farmers, but it's not clear exactly what you want the Government to do to achieve this.

We have published a petition calling on the Government to Support British Food Producers by ensuring that marks of origin remain, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300353

If you want the Government to take other measures, such as increasing subsidies for UK farmers, or imposing tariffs on agricultural imports, you could start a new petition requesting this.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
